title: How should my eyes move when I read? - Quora

response.answer_text: when learning to read single signs it will be like ‘follow that line’’ like tracing its shape with both eyes like you would do with the fingers of both hands and when you have been able to identify all then you get to learn what different sounds they are representing in your language.when three-signs combined mean something and you learn to put the three together then you will be able to ‘’immagine’’ tha meaning and reproduce the sounds of the three letters and make a word with your mouth-tongue-throat and the combination will be absorbed in to your brain as ^^^ sounds like ~~~ and means === and from there you start to move your eyes in a swiping kind of motion over the signs you recognise.from beginning to identify signs to being able to read a full sentence and pronounce outloud or inside your head will take a longer period.with words in bigger print on cards that you flip over quickly you can ‘’load’’ your knowledge of words in a fast way by simply looking at the card for a very short time. When many words are in your memory the reading will become more swiping short attention over a line of words.arabic is a left-handed right to left ways of producing sentences wit flowing lines and hebrew is more signs-by-sign and right to left as wellChinese is intricate symbols and drwan top to bottom and many languages have the left to right way of presentin (right-handed writing)there are so many different signs for many different languages with extra’s added like é or ç to alter pronunciation in certain languages. when you want to learn to speed up your reading there are several ways to improve from letterscanning to flowing fast swiping over several lines of print in a fast steady motion
Have you been overthinking? Your eyes should move however they feel comfortable moving. Books are usually read from left to right. Side to side.
